content.description: At a large university, the division of computing services surveyed a random sample of 45 biology majors and 55 business majors from populations of over 1,000 biology and 1,000 business majors. The sampled students were asked how many hours they spend per week using any university computer lab. Let <math alttext="x bar sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average hours per week spent in any university computer lab by the 45 biology majors, and let <math alttext="x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average hours per week spent in any university computer lab by the 55 business majors.
content.question: Which of the following is the best explanation for why the sampling distribution of <math alttext="x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> can be modeled with a normal distribution?

choices.label: The two sample standard deviations are assumed to be equal.
The sample sizes are both sufficiently large.
The distributions of the population are normal.
The population standard deviations are assumed equal.
There are at least 30 students in each of the two populations.

content.answer: The sample sizes are both sufficiently large.
